article_title: Do Dividend Investors Have Abnormal Brains?

article_metadata.author: Phil DeMuth

og.description: Some investors invest for dividends, and some invest for total returns.  Who does better? The answer from academe came in 1958 with the Nobel-prize winning Modigliani-Merton "indifference" theorem.  Modigliani and Merton argued that it should make no difference to investors, pre-tax, whether a company's returns come from dividends or capital gains: [...]
